file.name: manifest.xml
file.p: Manifest listing all files in the tree, and other controlled files in this directory. Follows structure of this file.

file.name: fulltext.html
file.p: Raw HTML from publisher site. May not be well-formed or valid HTML5.

file.name: fulltext.pdf.txt
file.p: Text file created from fulltext.xml with a converter.

file.name: fulltext.xml
file.p: Raw XML from publisher site. Probably well-formed but not necessarily schema-compliant.

file.name: results.json
file.p: Metadata and manifest output by quickscrape.

file.name: scholarly.html
file.p: Scholarly HTML, normally created by transforming a fulltext.* input

dir.name: expected
dir.p: Expected output for results/ directory; used for unit tests. Often an exact copy of results/

dir.name: images
dir.p: Images or similar graphics downloaded from publisher site. There may be many images for one CTree, one directory per downloaded image. Numbering and naming may be ad hoc until we work it out./

dir.name: results
dir.p: Output from ami plugins. Each plugin generates a new child of "results/", so "ami-word" will create a subdirectory "word". Most plugins have options and these create sub-subdirectories. Not sure if this is a fixed format yet.

file.name: results.xml
file.p: The results. The format will depend onthe plugin, but a commone example is entity in context for each fact.

file.name: results.html
file.p: Html transformation of XML, normally for easier viewing

dir.name: suppData
dir.p: Supplementary data from quickscrape or other scrapers, downloaders. One directory per data package. Formats will be highly variable, but here are some below.
